void* gps_state_thread ( void *  arg  ) 

Main GPS state thread - remains running until the Location application calls this interface's (*close) function.

The thread awaits incoming commands to START/STOP or QUIT execution and also for NMEA sentences from the receiver which it parses

Parameters:
[in] arg Pointer to an instance of this package's gps state structure, previously initialized
Returns:
NULL, always
abort:
none
Note:
The interface's Init function kicks off this thread. The thread runs forever or until the interface's (*close) function is called
void* gps_timer_thread ( void *  arg  ) 

Auxiliary thread whose purpose is to run at the requested fix_frequency rate.

Some modems' NMEA outputs cannot be controlled and may spit out packets much more frequently than desired by the controlling application. This thread ensures a fix is sent to the application only as often as that application wants.

Parameters:
arg [in] - pointer to a state variable which this thread will use to interact with other parts of this package
Note:
This thread is terminated whenever the interface is stopped and re-opened on an interface (*start) call.

It is terminated permanently when the (*close) function is called

void handle_rilgps ( GpsState *  statep,
int  fd 
)

Handle an incoming message from the RILGPS daemon.

Parameters:
[in] statep Pointer to the state structure stored in the main GPS state thread
[in] fd File descriptor representing the socket holding the message to be processed
Returns:
none
abort:
none
Note:
This function and any invoked by it are executed in the context of the main gps thread in swigps.c

The scope of the s_gpsbuf array is limited to this function and it's a statically-declared array. Care must be take to have completely emptied its contents before returning from this function.

void set_agps ( void   ) 

AT-Specific command to call when setting AGPS values on an AT modem.

Parameters:
none 
Returns:
None
Abort:
None
Note:
This function does nothing to configure the SUPL URL. When Sierra modules leave the factory the OEM customer has usually requested they be pre-configured for a variety of settings including the SUPL URL. This value tends to be carrier-specific too. Since Sierra modems hold their values in NV RAM, there is no need to reconfigure the setting every time this GPS module is started.

NOTE: In order for this function to work, OEM customers would need to specify an unlock password for CnD commands as a PRI option instead of/or in addition to the SUPL URL, and the code in swirilat_gps_at.c would need to be modified to add the password. If those conditions are met then this function could be altered to call swigps_setagps().

AT-Specific command to call when setting AGPS values on an AT modem.

Parameters:
none 
Returns:
None
Abort:
None
Note:
None
void set_defaults ( void   ) 

AT-Specific command to call when setting the default tracking values on an AT modem.

Parameters:
none 
Returns:
None
Abort:
None
Note:
The Sierra Wireless AT command-based modem uses the same command to start a tracking session as to set the default tracking values. If no session is currently running (easy case) then the defaults are stored locally in the state structure and nothing needs to be done

If tracking is enabled when the defaults are changed then the session must be stopped and restarted with the new settings

AT-Specific command to call when setting the default tracking values on an AT modem.

Parameters:
none 
Returns:
None
Abort:
None
Note:
None
void start_session ( void   ) 

AT-Specific command to be called when CMD_START is received by the GPS Main State thread.

Parameters:
none 
Returns:
None
Abort:
None
Note:
AT-RIL modems operate differently from Gobi-based ones. In a Gobi modem, simply opening the NMEA port has the effect of starting a tracking session, but in a Sierra modem using the AT-RIL, a specific command is needed to start tracking. This function is responsible for issuing that command

AT-Specific command to be called when CMD_START is received by the GPS Main State thread.

Parameters:
none 
Returns:
None
Abort:
None
Note:
On QMI devices, a tracking session is started as soon as the NMEA port is opened and that should already be done by the time this function is called
void stop_session ( void   ) 

AT-Specific command to be called when CMD_STOP is received by the GPS Main State thread.

Parameters:
none 
Returns:
None
Abort:
None
Note:
AT-RIL modems operate differently from Gobi-based ones. In a Gobi modem, simply closing the NMEA port has the effect of stopping a tracking session, but in a Sierra modem using the AT-RIL, a specific command is needed to stop tracking. This function is responsible for issuing that command

AT-Specific command to be called when CMD_STOP is received by the GPS Main State thread.

Parameters:
none 
Returns:
None
Abort:
None
Note:
On QMI devices, closing the NMEA port causes a tracking session to be stopped so this function does nothing

Method to indicate to the Vendor-specific GPS engine that the data connection has been closed.

Method to indicate to the AGPS interface that a requested data connection attempt has failed.

Method to indicate to the Vendor-specific GPS engine that the requested data connection has been opened.

int swiagps_set_server ( AGpsType  type,
const char *  hostname,
int  port 
)

Method to set the AGPS server information - gets sent to the modem.

The hostname string pointer can be either a valid URL or an ascii-coded IP address which will be converted to binary by this function.

int swigps_checkGpsCallbacks ( GpsCallbacks *  Callbackp  ) 

GpsCallbacks structure size validation for Gingerbread.

This function ensures the size field of the GpsCallbacks structure passed when the interface was opened is the same size as we're expecting. If not an error is returned

Parameters:
[in] callbackp Pointer to GpsCallback structure passed to us when the GPS module was started up
Returns:
0 - The sizes match -1 - There is a size mismatch
Abort:
none
Note:
void swigps_cleanup ( void   ) 

Closes all opened resources, terminates active threads and terminates the GPS session.

When done, there are no traces of the interface left in the system

Note:
Called outside of the context of this package

Returns:
0 - Always
Note:

int swigps_getagps ( int  rilgpsfd  ) 

Request AGPS settings from the modem.

This function builds and sends a request to the swiril_gps side (Outbound direction) blocking the caller until a response is received.

Parameters:
[in] rilgpsfd File descriptor for the socket connecting swigps to swiril_gps
Returns:
0 - The operation was successful < 0 - An error occurred: -ENOMEM - Insufficient storage (returned from subroutine call) -EINVAL - Internal failure (Abort would be appropriate)
Abort:
none
Note:
int swigps_getdef ( int  rilgpsfd  )

This function builds and sends a request to the swiril_gps side (Outbound direction) blocking the caller until a response is received.

Parameters:
[in] rilgpsfd File descriptor for the socket connecting swigps to swiril_gps
Returns:
0 - The operation was successful < 0 - An error occurred: -ENOMEM - Insufficient storage (returned from subroutine call) -EINVAL - Internal failure (Abort would be appropriate)
Abort:
none
Note:
int swigps_getnmeaport ( GPS_RILTYPE  riltype,
int  rilgpsfd 
)

Ask for the NMEA USB port name from the swiril side.

This function builds and sends a request to the swiril_gps side (Outbound direction).

Parameters:
[in] riltype The RIL type expected to be in use by the GPS vendor specific code. Used by the ril-daemon for validation purposes
[in] rilgpsfd File descriptor for the socket connecting swigps to swiril_gps
Returns:
0 - The operation was successful < 0 - An error occurred: -ENOMEM - Insufficient storage (returned from subroutine call) -EINVAL - Internal failure (Abort would be appropriate)
Abort:
none
Note:
This function is a key component in this swigps vendor-specific startup. The interface's "start()" function will return with an error until the NMEA port handle is known and the ENGINE ON status will only be returned when this function's counterpart, respGetNmeaPort() has been called with a valid handle. Therefore, calling this function is mandatory and should happen very early on in the main gps state thread's startup.
GpsState* swigps_getstatep ( void   )

Returns:

Note:
None
int swigps_init ( GpsCallbacks *  callbacks  ) 

Opens the interface and assigns the caller's callback function pointers through this interface.

These are called during runtime when fix information changes or when other status needs to be communicated to the host application

Parameters:
[in] Pointer to structure of type "GpsCallbacks"
Returns:
-1 if failed to open serial interface to modem's NMEA channel 0 if successfully started the interface
Note:
Called outside of the context of this package

If this entry was already called once before then subsequent calls quietly return "success" with no further action unless the cleanup interface function has been called

int swigps_inject_location ( double  latitude,
double  longitute,
float  accuracy 
)

Method to inject a rough location into the GPS engine to assist with reducing the time to first fix.

int swigps_inject_time ( GpsUtcTime  time,
int64_t  timeReference,
int  uncertainty 
)

Method to inject time into the GPS engine which can be used to provide a shorter time to first fix.

Parameters:
[in] time Elapsed time since Jan 1, 1970 in milliseconds. This is a 64 bit value
[in] timeReference a 64-bit value, Ignored by swigps
[in] uncertainty one half the round trip delay time between the NTP server and this android device
Note:
Called outside of the context of this package
int swigps_injtime ( int  rilgpsfd,
GpsUtcTime  time,
int  uncertainty 
)

Send a request to the modem to inject the current time.

Parameters:
[in] rilgpsfd File descriptor for the socket connecting swigps to swiril_gps
[in] time The current time to be injected
[in] uncertainty A measure of the quality of the time and its reference
Returns:
0 - The operation was successful < 0 - An error occurred: -ENOMEM - Insufficient storage (returned from subroutine call) -EINVAL - Internal failure (Abort would be appropriate)
Abort:
none
Note:
void swigps_report_state ( GpsCallbacks *  cbklistp,
GpsStatusValue  state 
)

GPS Status Callback function - called from gps state thread whenever there is a change in the modem's state that needs to be reported to the GPS Location Service.

Parameters:
cbkfp [in] Pointer to the callback function originally supplied by the location service when the swigps interface was opened
state [in] The new state to be reported to the gps location service
Returns:
none
Note:
The GpsStatus structure differs from Froyo to the newer Android releases
int swigps_setagps ( int  rilgpsfd,
unsigned int  ipaddr,
int  port,
char *  hostnamep 
)

Change AGPS settings As Specified.

This function builds and sends a request to the modem to change its AGPS settings to the ones specified by the caller.

Parameters:
[in] rilgpsfd File descriptor for the socket connecting swigps to swiril_gps
[in] ipaddr The IP address of the host server. NOTE: this is not provided by android and must be computed within swigps.c prior to calling this function.
[in] port Port number on the host computer which provides access to the AGPS server
[in] hostnamep Pointer to the string (URL) for the AGPS server
Returns:
0 - The operation was successful < 0 - An error occurred: -ENOMEM - Insufficient storage (returned from subroutine call) -EINVAL - Internal failure (Abort would be appropriate)
Abort:
none
Note:
int swigps_setdef ( int  rilgpsfd,
int  operation,
int  timeout,
int  interval,
int  accuracy,
bool  tracking 
)

Request a change to the GPS operating mode.

This function builds and sends a request to the sgr side (Outbound direction) to set the operating mode and other default GPS session values

Parameters:
[in] rilgpsfd File descriptor for the socket connecting swigps to swiril_gps
[in] operation The requested operating mode: 0: Standalone, 1: MS-based, 2: MS-assisted
[in] timeout The maximum time (sec) to work on each fix
[in] interval Interval (sec) between fix segments
[in] accuracy Requested accuracy of the fix (metres)
[in] tracking bool: 0, no tracking session in progress 1, tracking session underway in modem
Returns:
0 - The operation was successful < 0 - An error occurred: -ENOMEM - Insufficient storage (returned from subroutine call) -EINVAL - Internal failure (Abort would be appropriate)
Abort:
none
Note:
The response packet will contain an indication of the outcome of this request within the modem. A successful response must be sure to update the state structure with the values changed by this request
int swigps_start ( void   ) 

Starts the GPS receiver obtaining fixes.

Returns:
-1 if this interface's (*init) function hasn't been called 0 if the receiver successfully started
Note:
Called outside of the context of this package
int swigps_StartSession ( int  rilgpsfd,
int  operation,
int  timeout,
int  interval,
int  accuracy 
)

Send a request to the modem to Start a GPS tracking session.

Parameters:
[in] rilgpsfd File descriptor for the socket connecting swigps to swiril_gps
[in] operation The requested operating mode: 0: Standalone, 1: MS-based, 2: MS-assisted
[in] timeout The maximum time (sec) to work on each fix
[in] interval Interval (sec) between fix segments
[in] accuracy Requested accuracy of the fix (metres)
Returns:
0 - The operation was successful < 0 - An error occurred: -ENOMEM - Insufficient storage (returned from subroutine call) -EINVAL - Internal failure (Abort would be appropriate)
Abort:
none
Note:
int swigps_stop ( void   ) 

Stop sending fixes to the higher-layer applications.

Terminates the gps interface. The main thread for this package remains running and will start the interface again if the (*start) function is called

Returns:
-1 if this interface's (*init) function hasn't been called 0 success
Note:
Called outside of the context of this package
int swigps_StopSession ( int  rilgpsfd  )

Returns:
0 - The operation was successful < 0 - An error occurred: -ENOMEM - Insufficient storage (returned from subroutine call) -EINVAL - Internal failure (Abort would be appropriate)
Abort:

none

None
Note:
